result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:15 PM Defendant Zackary J. Vance not in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Zackary J. Vance.  Attorney Curtis E. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Burdick advises the defendant is in Stanley Correctional but has not yet been able to verifiy that.  ADA Johnson verifies the defendant is in Stanley Correctional.  Request for another adjourned initial appearance to allow Atty Burdick to get in touch with the defendant.  DAs office to prepare arrangements for video appearance at next hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:17 PM Defendant Zackary J. Vance appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will need to call SPD for representation.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of complaint.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
